page.title: 17HEADLAND`S FARM,BROUGHTON
page.content: ON 27th JUNE,1985 WE INTERVIEWED THE GRANDFATHER OF A CHILD IN OUR CLASS.HE LIVES AND WORKS AT HEADLANDS FARM. THIS FARM IS USED FOR REARING SHEEP AND CATTLE. THE CATTLE ARE KEPT FOR BEEF AND THE SHEEP FOR WOOL. SPRING LAMBS ARE KEPT FOR MEAT TOO.HE STARTED FARMING AT THE AGE OF 16.HE ENJOYS WALKING ROUND LOOKING AT THE CATTLE. HE WORKS FROM 6.00a.m.UNTIL 10.30p.m. YEARS AGO THERE WERE EIGHT WORKERS BUT NOW THERE IS ONLY HIMSELF.THERE ARE 104 ACRES OF LAND AROUND THE FARM. THE PROBLEMS ON THE FARM ARE FENCING BECAUSE PEOPLE KEEP BREAKING THEM. THE REAL OWNER OF HEADLANDS FARM LIVES IN WELLINGBOROUGH AND ALSO OWNS A SCRAPYARD. THE BIG CHANGES IN FARMING CAME IN ABOUT 1948 WHEN LARGE MACHINES STARTED TO BE USED AS WELL AS FERTILISERS AND CHEMICAL SPRAYS.
